data.title: 1 Carats to Grams (ct to gm) Converter- 1 ct is 0.2 gm
data.meta_description: Convert Carats to Grams - Know How to Convert from Carats to Grams Formula & Examples of Carats to Grams & 1 to 100 Carat to Gram Conversion Table.
data.text:
At first, converting any unit of measurement always looks cumbersome and a complex task to perform. But once the user gets familiar with the right kind of formula and understands the relationship between the unit of measurement, everything gets easy-peasy.

Knowing and understanding the same procedure helps to solve the equation better. Therefore, it is important that a user understands the relationship between a carat and gram, followed by the necessary conversion steps.

This blog will help you understand it all, starting from the meaning to their relationship, formula, conversion process and examples. Therefore, keep reading to understand all these and a lot more.

What are Carats?

A carat is a measurement unit that is used to measure weight. It is normally used for measuring gemstones. A carat is normally seen as ⅕ of grams or as 200 milligrams. A stone is measured till they reach their nearest 100th of 1 carat. A point is also defined as 1/100th of the carat. Thus, you can easily name 0.10 carat stone as ten points or 1/10th of the single carat. A smaller stone, on the other hand, is normally defined as 0.10 ct or 0.05 ct. A carat is basically used to define the fineness of gold.

The abbreviation used for carats is ‘ct’.

What are Grams?

A gram is seen as the International System of Units. A gram is a unit of mass which is defined as the basis for a kilogram and a gram is seen as 1/1000 of a kilogram. But as soon as 2019 ended, a kilogram was no longer defined as the International System of Unit and rather is now established on the Planck’s constants, i.e, ‘h’.

Relationship between Carats and Grams

Grams and Carats are two different units of measurement that are used for different purposes, but that does not mean that they don’t share any relationship with each other. While calculating the same, the users may find it difficult to solve. However, it is a simple calculation to perform.

The relationship between Carats and Grams is showcased in the following way:

1 carat = ⅕ grams

1 gram = 5 carats

How to Convert Carats to Grams?

Any form of conversion and calculation may look complex and intimidating when a user is not aware of their relationship. Therefore, it is always recommended to learn about their relationship as part of your first step and then continue with the process of conversion.

But as we have already mentioned the relationship between the two units of measurement, the conversion process of carats to grams will not seem as difficult as it would have been at the beginning. So, to convert carats to grams, you are required to simply divide the value by 5 and the final result will be in grams.

There are chances that you still find it a little painstaking. Therefore, to make it easier for you, we have curated some examples to make you better understand the same.

Formula of Converting Carats to Grams

The formula of converting carats to grams follows a simple process of calculation. Although, the only point that you are expected to keep in your mind at all times is their theory and mathematical expression.

The Demonstration of the formula of converting carats to grams is:

Carats = ⅕ grams

After the representation of the formula that is required for you to use, we have set some examples for you.

Carats to Grams Conversion Examples

Example 1: Convert 1 carat to grams

Solution: After placing the unit of a gram into the formula above, the result will be

Carats = 1 / 5 = 0.2 grams

Therefore, 1 carat is equal to 0.2 grams.

Example 2: Convert 67 carat to grams

Solution: After placing the unit of a gram into the formula above, the result will be

Carats = 67 / 5 = 13.4 grams

Therefore, 67 carats are equal to 13.4 grams.

Example 3 Convert 25 carat to grams

Solution: After placing the unit of a gram into the formula above, the result will be

Carats = 25 / 5 = 5 grams

Therefore, 25 carats are equal to 5 grams.

Example 4: Convert 11 carat to grams

Solution: After placing the unit of a gram into the formula above, the result will be

Carats = 11 / 5 = 2.2 grams

Therefore, 11 carats are equal to 2.2 grams.

Example 5: Convert 100 carat to grams

Solution: After placing the unit of a gram into the formula above, the result will be

Carats = 100 / 5 = 20 grams

Therefore, 100 carats is equal to 20 grams.

Example 6: Convert 16 carat to grams

Solution: After placing the unit of a gram into the formula above, the result will be

Carats = 16 / 5 = 3.2 grams

Therefore, 16 carats are equal to 3.2 grams.

Example 7: Convert 98 carat to grams

Solution: After placing the unit of a gram into the formula above, the result will be

Carats = 98 / 5 = 19.6 grams

Therefore, 98 carats are equal to 19.6 grams.

Example 8: Convert 33 carat to grams

Solution: After placing the unit of a gram into the formula above, the result will be

Carats = 33 / 5 = 6.6 grams

Therefore, 33 carats are equal to 6.6 grams.

Example 9: Convert 45 carat to grams

Solution: After placing the unit of a gram into the formula above, the result will be

Carats = 45 / 5 = 9 grams

Therefore, 45 carats are equal to 9 grams.

Example 10: Convert 24 carat to grams

Solution: After placing the unit of a gram into the formula above, the result will be

Carats = 24 / 5 = 4.8 grams

Therefore, 24 carats are equal to 4.8 grams.

Don’t miss It!

Carats to Grams Conversion Table

Current Use of Carats

A carat is a unit of measurement that is used to measure weight, originally for a gemstone like a diamond. On the other hand, it is also used to define the proportion and fineness of the gold.

Current Use of Grams

A gram is normally used to measure the non-liquid substances of your kitchen. When you check it closely, you can see that there is a measurement of all your food items. Such labels help you to check the unit of grams of the products.

FAQ’s about Convert Carat to Gram

Q1. How many carats are there in a gram?

A gram consists of 1/5th of a carat.

Q2. How many grams does 1 carat diamond weigh?

0.200 grams is a weight of 1 carat.

Q3. How do you measure carats in grams?

In order to convert a carat into a gram, you are supposed to divide the weight of the same by 5.
